newsitem.title: USA: Medicus Systems CEO gets chairman post.
newsitem.headline: Medicus Systems CEO gets chairman post.

text.p: Medicus Systems Corp said Friday that Patrick Sommers was named chairman of its board of directors, replacing the founder, Richard Jelinek.
Sommers will remain chief executive officer.
In January, Medicus said Jelinek would step down as chairman but remain a director.
Medicus said it has completed the shareholder-approved repurchase of one million shares of common stock and 500 shares of voting preferred stock from Jelinek.
The repurchased stock, including approximately 15.6 percent of the outstanding common shares and 100 percent of the authorized voting preferred, will be retired.
The company paid Jelinek an aggregate purchase price of $4,500,000 in cash, $2,000,000 in two year notes, and 400,000 warrants to purchase common stock exercisable at $8.00 per share
The company said it expects the action to have a positive impact on future earnings per share.
Medicus provides hospitals and integrated healthcare delivery networks with software and services to capture, structure and analyze information.
